1.VerseHTML:
1The heavens are telling of the glory of God;

And their expanse is declaring the work of His hands.

2.VerseHTML:
2Day to day pours forth speech,

And night to night reveals knowledge.

3.VerseHTML:
3There is no speech, nor are there words;

Their voice is not heard.

4.VerseHTML:
4Their line has gone out through all the earth,

And their utterances to the end of the world.

In them He has placed a tent for the sun,

5.VerseHTML:
5Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber;

It rejoices as a strong man to run his course.

6.VerseHTML:
6Its rising is from one end of the heavens,

And its circuit to the other end of them;

And there is nothing hidden from its heat.

7.VerseHTML:
7The law of the LORD is perfect, restoring the soul;

The testimony of the LORD is sure, making wise the simple.

8.VerseHTML:
8The precepts of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart;

The commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes.

9.VerseHTML:
9The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring forever;

The judgments of the LORD are true; they are righteous altogether.

10.VerseHTML:
10They are more desirable than gold, yes, than much fine gold;

Sweeter also than honey and the drippings of the honeycomb.

11.VerseHTML:
11Moreover, by them Your servant is warned;

In keeping them there is great reward.

12.VerseHTML: 12Who can discern his errors? Acquit me of hidden faults.

13.VerseHTML:
13Also keep back Your servant from presumptuous sins;

Let them not rule over me;

Then I will be blameless,

And I shall be acquitted of great transgression.

14.VerseHTML:
14Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart

Be acceptable in Your sight,

O LORD, my rock and my Redeemer.
